titleStmt.title: B. J. Spalding to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4604

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Glasgow Ky January 1st 64
To Thomas E Bramblet
Governor of Kantucky

We are & have been acquainted with one G W. Dunn now confinded in the state prison for some offence (we understand) commited at Louisville Ky we know nothing of the charge or offince. But we know that said Dunn has always been regarded as an honest peacible citizen was & is now or at the time of the offence a soldier of the 34th regt of Ky Vols If he be guilty of said offence he certainly was superinduced by bad men who had controle of him He as a poor man has a wife and two little children
We now wish respectfully & earnestly for you to extend him pardon
B J Spalding Lieut Conl 37th Ky Vol
From all that I can learn about the condition of young Dunn It would be I think right to pardon him and I hope you will do so and let him return to the army
the undersigned Union soldiers would wish Dunn's pardon

James M Adams 1st Lieut 33rd Ky Vol
Joseph M Starths 33rd Ky
George W Boles -- 33 Ky
Bennett Robertson- 33 Ky
Eliga Saltsman Do Ky
L S Saltsman Do ky
